moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 dxe4: By exchanging, Miyasaki gives Westerinen a central edge for free.
moves.4. Nxe4 Nd7 5. Nf3 Ngf6 6. Nxf6+: Westerinen begins clearing lines at once.
moves.7. Bc4: Westerinen increases the pressure with quick development.
moves.7... c5: Miyasaka at last tries to free his game.
moves.8. O-O: Prudently safeguarding the King befor engaging in complications.
moves.8... cxd4: This exchange merely opens more lines for the Finn to use as attacking alleys.
moves.9. Nxd4: Now the Knight is powerfully centralized.
moves.9... a6: A completely wasted move, giving an extra tempo to Westerinen.
moves.10. b3: Preparing to plant the B on the long diagonal, aiming ominously at the King-side.
moves.11... Qc7: Giving himself the pleasure of threatening ...BxP ch.
moves.12... O-O: Removing the K from the center.
moves.14... e4: This disastrous move costs the game at once.
moves.15. Nh6+: Black resigns. If 15... PxN 16 QxN [threatening 17 Q-N7 mate] shatters Black's defenses. 15... K-R1 falls to 16 QxN PxQ 17 QBxP mate.
